title: Neville on Rooney's future
text:
Gary Neville on Wayne Rooney's future: I'd like him to stay at Manchester United   1:18pm Gary Neville admits he finds the timing of Wayne Rooney's potential move from Manchester United to China 'strange' Gary Neville understands why Wayne Rooney might want to move to China, but hopes he stays at Manchester United for the rest of the season. 
The striker's agent, Paul Stretford, has flown to Asia to hold talks with Chinese Super League clubs before their transfer window closes on Tuesday. 
Rooney has 18 months left on his contract with an option to extend the deal by a year, but has started only three games in the last two months. 
However, former United team-mate Neville says it would be "strange timing" if Jose Mourinho allowed him to leave now with the club still fighting in four competitions. 
"I'd like to think Wayne Rooney would stay at Manchester United," he told Sky Sports News HQ . 
"It's strange timing - the [English] transfer window over and yet this debate when there's still two months of the season to go. That seems odd. There's still a contribution to be make and many trophies to be played for and won at United. 
"I haven't got a clue [if he'll move before Tuesday's China deadline]. I've known Wayne for a long time but I haven't spoken to him. Man Utd vs So'ton
